metadata.title: CVE-2020-27840 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in samba. Spaces used in a string around a domain name(DN), while supposed to be ignored, can cause invalid DN strings withspaces to instead write a zero-byte into out-of-bounds memory, resulting ina crash. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:2.0.10-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libldb2 - 2:2.0.10-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
python3-ldb - 2:2.0.10-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldb package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.0.10-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
